entities.name: library
entities.description: The library is mentioned as a place where she was going to, but it's not clear if she actually went there. The text says 'She was off to the library'.

entities.name: village
entities.description: The village is mentioned as a place where many magical families banded together for mutual support and protection. It's described in A History of Magic by Bathilda Bagshot.

entities.name: A History of Magic
entities.description: The book is mentioned as a source of information about the village. The text says 'There's a bit about the village in A History of Magic'.

entities.name: Bathilda Bagshot
entities.description: The author is mentioned as the writer of the book 'A History of Magic'. The text says 'A History of Magic by Bathilda Bagshot'.

entities.name: Tinworthin Cornwald
entities.description: The village is mentioned as one of the notable villages that attracted several magical families. The text says 'The villages of Tinworthin Cornwald...'.

entities.name: Upper Flagley
entities.description: The village is mentioned as one of the notable villages that attracted several magical families. The text says '...Upper Flagley in Yorkshire...'.

entities.name: Godric's Hollow
entities.description: The village is mentioned as one of the notable villages that attracted several magical families. The text says '...and Godric's Hollow'.

entities.name: Ottery St. Catchpole
entities.description: The village is mentioned as one of the notable villages that attracted several magical families. The text says '...and Ottery St. Catchpole on the south coast of England'.

relationships.description: The village is described in A History of Magic. The text says 'There's a bit about the village in A History of Magic'.
The village is written about by Bathilda Bagshot. The text says 'A History of Magic by Bathilda Bagshot'.
